parameters.name: acl
parameters.description: A pointer to the access control list that you want to get an entry from.

parameters.name: entry_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the entry you want to get; one of the following:

  
ACL_FIRST_ENTRY â get the first entry in the ACL.
    
  
ACL_NEXT_ENTRY â get the next entry in the ACL.

parameters.name: entry_p
parameters.description: A pointer to a location where the function can store a pointer to the entry.

return_values.description:
The ACL has no entries, or the last entry was returned by a previous call to
  acl_get_entry().

full_content:
Function: acl_get_entry
URL: https://www.qnx.com/developers/docs/7.1/com.qnx.doc.neutrino.lib_ref/topic/a/acl_get_entry.html
Synopsis: int acl_get_entry( acl_t acl,
Headers: #include <sys/acl.h>
Parameters:
  - acl: A pointer to the access control list that you want to get an entry from.
  - entry_id: The ID of the entry you want to get; one of the following:

  
ACL_FIRST_ENTRY â get the first entry in the ACL.
    
  
ACL_NEXT_ENTRY â get the next entry in the ACL.
  - entry_p: A pointer to a location where the function can store a pointer to the entry.
Return Values:
  - 1: An entry was found.
  - 0: The ACL has no entries, or the last entry was returned by a previous call to
  acl_get_entry().
  - -1: An error occurred
  (errno
  is set).
Examples:
Example 1:
#include <sys/acl.h>

int acl_get_entry( acl_t acl,
                   int entry_id,
                   acl_entry_t *entry_p );
